exampleContent.title: How to categorize sensory details
exampleContent.description: Here's an example of how sensory details can be categorized by the sense they appeal to.
learningPoints: Each category represents one of our five senses
Notice how specific details help create vivid mental images
Good writing often combines multiple sensory details
These details make descriptions more engaging and memorable
exampleContent.introduction: When you write, you can use **sensory details** to make stories and scenes easier for the reader to imagine. A sensory detail makes the reader imagine a particular sight, sound, smell, taste, or touch.

sight.solution: This helps you imagine the color and appearance of the sun
This describes what the clouds look like

sound.solution: This describes what you would hear
This helps you imagine the sound of thunder

smell.solution: This helps you imagine the flower's fragrance

taste.solution: This describes what something tastes like
This helps you imagine the taste

touch.solution: This describes how something feels to touch
This helps you imagine the texture

practiceExample.question: Categorize these sensory details by the sense they appeal to

exercises.question: Sort these animals by their habits.
exercises.instruction: Drag each animal to the correct category based on where they primarily live.

feedback.correct: Great job! You correctly sorted the animals by their habitats.
feedback.incorrect: Some animals are in the wrong category. Think about where each animal naturally lives.
hints: Dolphins and sharks live in water
Elephants and lions live on land
